summary.para: An structure that specifies the program counter.
x86: The program counter is EIP.
Intel Itanium: The program counter is StIIP.
x64: The program counter is RIP.

member.name: STACKFRAME.AddrReturn
member.summary: An structure that specifies the return address.

summary.para: An structure that specifies the frame pointer.
x86: The frame pointer is EBP.
Intel Itanium: There is no frame pointer, but AddrBStore is used.
x64: The frame pointer is RBP or RDI. This value is not always used.
An structure that specifies the stack pointer.
x86: The stack pointer is ESP.
Intel Itanium: The stack pointer is SP.
x64: The stack pointer is RSP.

member.name: STACKFRAME.FuncTableEntry
member.summary: On x86 computers, this member is an structure. If there is no function table entry, this member is NULL.

member.name: STACKFRAME.Params
member.summary: The possible arguments to the function.

member.name: STACKFRAME.Far
member.summary: This member is TRUE if this is a WOW far call.

member.name: STACKFRAME.Virtual
member.summary: This member is TRUE if this is a virtual frame.

member.name: STACKFRAME.Reserved
member.summary: This member is used internally by the function.

member.name: STACKFRAME.KdHelp
member.summary: A structure that specifies helper data for walking kernel callback frames.

member.name: STACKFRAME.AddrBStore
member.summary: Intel Itanium: An structure that specifies the backing store (RsBSP).

x86: The program counter is EIP.
Intel Itanium: The program counter is StIIP.
x64: The program counter is RIP.

x64: The frame pointer is RBP or RDI. This value is not always used.

Intel Itanium: The stack pointer is SP.
x64: The stack pointer is RSP.

member.summary: The possible arguments to the function.

member.summary: This member is TRUE if this is a WOW far call.

member.name: STACKFRAME.Virtual
member.summary: This member is TRUE if this is a virtual frame.

member.name: STACKFRAME.Reserved
member.summary: This member is used internally by the function.
